headline: What went wrong the night Altadena burned
description: A Washington Post analysis shows that some officials knew of the fire’s westward spread hours before evacuation orders were sent to residents in western Altadena.

headline: Trade War Retaliation Will Hit Trump Voters Hardest
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Nearly 8 million Americans work in industries targeted by the levies and the majority are Trump voters, a New York Times analysis shows

headline: Trump visits Justice Department for speech that breaks all norms
description: Donald Trump railed against the federal prosecutions he once faced during a rare presidential visit to the Justice Department.

headline: Draft List for New Travel Ban Proposes Trump Target 43 Countries
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: A draft circulating inside the administration lists three tiers of countries whose citizens may face restrictions on entering the United States.

headline: How Each Senator Voted to Fund the Government Through September
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Senate voted to advance a bill to fund the federal government through September and avoid a shutdown on Saturday.

headline: How senators voted on a bill to avert a government shutdown
description: The Senate is voting on a measure to extend federal funding through September. See how your lawmaker voted.

headline: Las acciones entran en corrección y los inversores se decepcionan de Trump
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: El movimiento se debe al creciente pesimismo de los inversores respecto a los pronunciamientos políticos volátiles de Washington en las últimas semanas.

headline: Trump wants Guantánamo to hold 30,000 migrants. So far it has held about 300.
description: Trump’s plan to vastly expand migrant detentions at the Guantánamo Bay Naval Station in Cuba has proven costly and logistically complicated.

headline: How Education Department layoffs hit student loans, testing, civil rights
description: The layoffs call into question how agency will be able to handle major operations such as student loans, FAFSA, the Nation’s Report Card and civil rights complaints.

headline: Dr. Oz goes to Washington
description: Mehmet Oz has made a successful career on TV and online, promoting often unproven weight loss treatments and supplements. Now the physician is poised to run two of America’s largest health care programs.

headline: Stocks Tumble Into Correction as Investors Sour on Trump
label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: The S&P 500 is now more than 10 percent below its last record high — a line in the sand for investors worried about a sell-off gathering steam.

headline: Trump's Tariffs Are Hitting Critical Goods That Contribute to the US Trade Deficit
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Trump wants to reduce the $1.2 trillion trade deficit, so he's putting tariffs on popular imported goods from smartphones to household appliances.

headline: Five years since the pandemic began, covid may now be endemic, experts say
description: The pandemic may be over, but the endemic disease is still a threat, especially for older adults and those with certain risk factors.

headline: Where to see cherry blossoms in the D.C. area, mapped
description: These maps show some of the best places to see cherry blossoms in Washington D.C., Maryland and Virginia.

headline: On the Trail of the Los Angeles Fires
label: https://www.nytimes.com/insider/
description: We hiked to the origins of the Palisades and Eaton fires to investigate how they started.

headline: Where U.S. Measles Outbreaks Are Spreading
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: As new cases are reported, our maps and illustrations show the spread of the virus and how infections can run through a community.

headline: How every House member voted on the bill to avert a government shutdown
description: The House passed a measure to extend federal funding through September. See how your lawmaker voted.

headline: How Each House Member Voted on the Bill to Avoid a Government Shutdown
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The House passed a measure to fund the federal government through September.

headline: China Piles the Pressure on India in Its Own Backyard
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Over the past decade, China has built up economic and military ties across the Indian Ocean. The region holds 40% of the world's offshore oil and four of the most important maritime chokepoints.

headline: What Does a Shutdown Have to Do With the Budget or Elon Musk? Here’s a Guide.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: A short-term spending bill, a 10-year budget plan and Musk’s cost-cutting team are all progressing at once.

headline: What happened the last time Trump imposed tariffs on steel and aluminum
description: A look at the 2018 tariffs on metals and what they can tell us about this round.

headline: Appeals court explains why it concluded Trump may fire Dellinger
description: A brief order allowed President Donald Trump to remove Hampton Dellinger, head of the Office of Special Counsel, while litigation over his firing continued.

headline: 15 Lessons Scientists Learned About Us When the World Stood Still
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The pandemic gave researchers a rare opportunity to study human behavior. Their work offers lessons about loneliness, remote work, high heels and more.

headline: Visualizing Ukraine’s military aid after the U.S. freeze
description: Since 2022, the United States has allocated more than $120 billion in aid to Ukraine. European nations have collectively allocated over $140 billion.

headline: Maps: US interest puts Greenland in focus
description: Trump’s persistent interest has focused international attention on the sparsely populated island

headline: Onomatopoeia Odyssey
description: No description available

headline: Man shot outside White House had BB gun and ‘cell phone handgun,’ police say
description: D.C. police identified Andrew Dawson, of North Manchester, Indiana, as the man shot and critically wounded by Secret Service personnel early Sunday.

headline: A trade war could hit these communities hardest
description: Chinese and Canadian retaliatory tariffs are aimed at agricultural, manufacturing and energy sectors that employ millions of Americans.

headline: 30 Charts That Show How Covid Changed Everything in March 2020
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: It can be easy to forget, or look away from, the pain and disruption of the pandemic. The numbers will be there to remind us.

headline: El sistema de trasplantes de órganos en EE. UU. está ‘en caos’ porque se ignoran las listas de espera
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: Se supone que los pacientes más enfermos tienen prioridad para recibir trasplantes que salvan vidas, pero cada vez mayor frecuencia se les está pasando por alto.

headline: These Words Are Disappearing in the New Trump Administration
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Federal agencies have issued guidance to employees on hundreds of terms to limit or avoid using. An analysis of government websites shows many of the same words being removed.

headline: How many goals Alex Ovechkin needs to break Wayne Gretzky’s NHL record
description: Capitals star Alex Ovechkin is closing in on Wayne Gretzky’s mark of 894. Amid his pursuit, here’s a closer look at his career.

headline: It’s not just the Gulf of Mexico. Why is so much of America named after foreign countries?
description: Our exhaustive search of American place names discovered that one country has been a shockingly dominant source of inspiration. You’ll never guess which one.

headline: Private Prisons Are Ramping Up Detention of Immigrants and Cashing In
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: The Trump administration is expected to use thousands more beds in these facilities as part of its mass deportation effort.

headline: The China-US face-off: a visual guide to Donald Trump and Xi Jinping’s inner circles
label: https://www.scmp.com/china/
description: Discover the power players in Xi Jinping and Donald Trump’s teams; the key people setting the agenda on diplomacy, the military, the economy, security and science.

headline: Head of watchdog agency ends lawsuit to stop his firing by Trump
description: Hampton Dellinger also sought to halt the firing of some probationary government employees amid the Trump administration’s workforce cuts.

headline: Fired, Then Rehired, by the Trump Administration
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Hundreds of federal workers — many of them in critical health and national security jobs — have been brought back, sometimes within days of their initial firings.

headline: A Threat on the Right to Britain’s Conservatives, as Donors Fund a Populist Rival
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: A New York Times analysis of campaign finance data shows an influx of funding to Nigel Farage’s anti-immigration Reform U.K. party from fossil fuel investors, climate skeptics and multimillionaires.

headline: Trump quiere aumentar las detenciones y deportaciones, pero la logística es un reto
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: Dentro del gobierno, existe una creciente frustración por el ritmo de las detenciones y deportaciones, incluso mientras Trump moviliza todo el gobierno federal para realizar la mayor operación de deportación de la historia de EE. UU.

headline: Appeals court allows Trump to remove watchdog Hampton Dellinger for now
description: A lower court had blocked the president from firing Dellinger, head of the Office of Special Counsel.

headline: A Timeline of Cuts, Legal Orders and Chaos at U.S.A.I.D.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Trump administration's moves to halt foreign assistance and lay off thousands at the nation's lead aid agency have been met with legal challenges that quickly ascended to the Supreme Court. See the major moments.

headline: Frustration Grows Inside the White House Over Pace of Deportations
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: President Trump’s promise to launch the largest deportation operation in U.S. history is colliding with the practical difficulties of detaining people and transporting them across the globe.

headline: Satellite Imagery Shows Gaza's Destruction, and Resilience, With War Unresolved
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: With 40% of structures still intact, Gazans have repopulated major cities with tents and tarpaulins.

headline: A tinderbox conflict in Congo is ready to explode
description: A conflict that has simmered in Democratic Republic of Congo’s eastern borderlands for years is set to erupt into a wider regional war.

headline: How Soon Could Ukraine’s Forces ‘Start to Buckle’ Without U.S. Weapons?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: It could be as little as four months, say analysts, as Europe scrambles to plug the hole in support left by President Trump’s suspension of military aid.

headline: You’ve never heard that in a presidential address to Congress before
description: Trump used more than two dozen words Tuesday night that had never been spoken in a State of the Union or similar address to Congress.

headline: Visualizing Trump’s effort to reshape America through executive orders
description: What Trump has done with executive orders, actions in his first six weeks

headline: El miedo a las deportaciones masivas silenció un barrio de Nueva York
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: En Corona, un enclave neoyorquino antaño vibrante, hogar de generaciones de migrantes latinos, muchos residentes ahora temen salir a la calle.

headline: The Problem With Car Tariffs: What’s an Import?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Supply chains extend across U.S. borders with Mexico and Canada, making it hard to say what’s American-made.

headline: What the Data Shows About Trump’s Immigration Enforcement So Far
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Arrests inside the country are up sharply relative to the Biden administration but below levels seen when agents made a show of force at the start of President Trump’s term.

headline: How Each Senator Voted to Confirm Linda McMahon as Education Secretary
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Senate confirmed Ms. McMahon to lead the Education Department by a party-line vote of 51 to 45.

headline: Here’s what could get more expensive if Trump goes through with tariffs
description: Tomatoes, T-shirts and cars are among the vast array of goods that could become pricier with new tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.

headline: 10-Minute Challenge: A ‘Decisive Moment’ in Street Photography
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

headline: The list of 2025 Oscar winners
description: “Anora” dominated the Academy Awards, where Adrien Brody and Mikey Madison took home the top acting prizes.

headline: See how tariffs could make your next car cost thousands more
description: From raw metal to engines, components travel all over North America before they’re put into cars. What happens if they’re taxed at every stop?

headline: An Immigrant Neighborhood Where Trump Made Inroads Now Fears ICE Raids
label: https://www.nytimes.com/nyregion/
description: In Corona, a once-vibrant New York City enclave home to generations of Latino immigrants, the threat of mass deportations has made many residents afraid to go outside.

headline: Judge says Trump cannot fire head of independent watchdog agency
description: The federal judge’s decision blocks Trump from removing Hampton Dellinger as head of the Office of Special Counsel and sets up a likely Supreme Court battle over the president’s powers.

headline: The lives lost in Gaza: A closer look at those killed in the conflict so far
description: The death toll from the war already dwarfs the numbers killed in previous bouts of fighting between Israelis and Palestinians in Gaza over many decades.

headline: DOGE Risks a New $5 Billion Headache for Struggling US Landlords
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/
description: The Trump administration is rapidly cutting office leases, adding space to an already strained commercial real estate market.

headline: More Than 70 Million Americans Are on Medicaid. This Is Where They Live.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: As Republicans weigh deep cuts, these congressional districts — some red, some blue — have the most to lose.

headline: Kai Tak Stadium: a game-changer for Hong Kong
label: https://www.scmp.com/hong_kong/
description: It’s finally showtime for Kai Tak Stadium, the centrepiece of Hong Kong’s new HK$30 billion (US$3.85 billion) Kai Tak Sports Park. Almost six years in the making, the 50,000-seat stadium was built to boost Hong Kong as a global stop for sports, entertainment and other mega-events.

headline: Trump’s tax on trade
description: Take a closer look at the $3 trillion the U.S. spends on imports.

headline: The People Carrying Out Musk’s Plans at DOGE
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Times identified 50 people within the so-called Department of Government Efficiency, a group formed by Elon Musk that in a short few weeks has radically upended federal agencies.

headline: The Organ Transplant List Is Being Ignored
label: https://www.nytimes.com/video/
description: Organ transplant waiting lists are designed to fairly distribute organs to the sickest patients in order of priority. Or so we thought. A New York Times investigation shows that the list leaves many patients waiting for organs despite being next in line. Brian Rosenthal, a New York Times reporter, explains how this list became so unreliable.

headline: Organ Transplant System ‘in Chaos’ as Waiting Lists Are Ignored
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The sickest patients are supposed to get priority for lifesaving transplants. But more and more, they are being skipped over.

headline: Mapping Ukraine’s mineral deal with the US
description: Ukraine said on Wednesday that it had reached a framework agreement with the United States on jointly developing Ukraine’s natural resources including rare earths, critical minerals, oil and gas.

headline: How Trump’s mostly White Cabinet compares with others
description: Trump’s Cabinet is far from representing the country’s racial and ethnic diversity. However, he has significantly increased the proportion of women within his advisers.

headline: Tracking key Supreme Court cases of the 2024-2025 term
description: Follow major cases facing the Supreme Court in 2025. The Supreme Court is set to weigh in on cases related to ghost guns, the death penalty, medical care for transgender minors, public funding for religious schools and more.

headline: These countries could lose the most, if U.S. stops aid
description: A deep dive into U.S. aid assistance and which countries have received the most of it.

headline: Elon Musk’s business empire is built on $38 billion in government funding
description: Government infusions at key moments helped Tesla and SpaceX flourish, boosting Musk’s wealth.

headline: What Can House Republicans Cut Instead of Medicaid? Not Much.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: The math of the G.O.P.’s goals makes the move almost unavoidable.

headline: How Each House Member Voted on the Budget Blueprint
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: House members voted 217 to 215 to approve a budget resolution, a critical step toward passing much of President Trump’s legislative agenda.

headline: How every House member voted on the ‘big, beautiful’ budget bill
description: The House passed a budget resolution in advance of a March 14 deadline to avert a government shutdown. See how your lawmaker voted.

label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: No description available

headline: What has Trump done today?
description: Keep tabs on the Trump administration’s daily actions and executive orders, and follow the stories that are most important to you.

headline: Gaza's garbage crisis
label: https://www.reuters.com/world/
description: More than a year of conflict has crippled the already limited waste collection infrastructure in Gaza. Hundreds of thousands of tons of solid waste has piled up in the streets.

headline: Germany Election Maps: How Conservatives Regained Power
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Maps show how every district in Germany voted. The conservative Christian Democrats have won the most seats while the far-right AfD placed second.

headline: At Federal Bureau of Prisons, senior retirements add to uncertainty
description: At least six top Federal Bureau of Prisons officials have announced plans to retire in coming months, including acting director William Lothrop.

headline: Live: German election results
label: https://www.reuters.com/world/
description: CDU/CSU look set to win, but far-right AfD are projected to have a strong night.

headline: Germany’s Economy Was Once the Envy of Europe. Not Anymore
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Metrics reveal an economy sliding backward. It will be one of the biggest issues in the election set for Sunday.

headline: The House Wants to Pass Trump’s Agenda in One Big Bill. Here’s What’s in It.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The G.O.P. bill would extend tax cuts and almost certainly make big reductions to programs serving the poor. Passing it may be hard, though.

headline: EE. UU. expulsó abruptamente a los migrantes enviados a Guantánamo

label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: No description available

description: A transfer operation on Thursday repatriated 177 Venezuelans via a handoff in Honduras, while one migrant was brought back to U.S. soil.

headline: How every senator voted on Kash Patel for FBI director
description: The Senate confirmed Kash Patel as FBI director in a vote on Thursday. See how your senators voted.

headline: How Each Senator Voted to Confirm Kash Patel as F.B.I. Director
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Senate confirmed Mr. Patel by a vote of 51 to 49 to lead the country’s premier federal law enforcement agency.

headline: How Elon Musk used X to amplify Germany’s far right ahead of election
description: Musk won AfD a massive new audience, and JD Vance added support. That brought the party outsized attention, but the impact in Germany was limited, data shows.

headline: Their home is still standing, but their neighborhood is gone
description: Douglas Rogers saved his home and some of his neighbors’ homes from burning down during the Eaton Fire, but a huge swath of their block is destroyed.

headline: Losing is the Wizards’ way. It might also be their way out.
description: The worst NBA franchise this century is enduring its worst year yet. That’s part of the plan to someday turn things around.

headline: How Germany's economic strength became a weakness
label: https://www.reuters.com/world/
description: Germany's economic malaise has led some citizens to embrace populist parties, including on the far right. What does that mean for Sunday's election? And how did Germany arrive here?

label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/

headline: The 2026 Milan-Cortina Olympics will bring the world together — sort of
description: The complicating part of staging a Winter Games in the Italian Alps? Getting around the Italian Alps, but such hurdles might be the future.

headline: Trump casts psychiatric and weight-loss drugs as threats to children
description: Trump directed a panel headed by HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to assess “the prevalence of and threat” posed by SSRIs, mood stabilizers, stimulants, and weight-loss drugs.

headline: Where SNL has found 50 seasons of funny people, and why it matters
description: How the comedy roots of “Saturday Night Live” cast members over 50 seasons have helped make the show unpredictable and sometimes unforgettable.
